website_summaries.verdict: The Dropcam Pro dramatically improves on the company's already impressive previous generation wireless home-monitoring camera.
pros: The Dropcam Pro improves on the image and two-way talk feature of the original Dropcam HD.
It's easy to use and set up, and you can view a remote video feed over the Internet or on your iOS or Android mobile device via free Dropcam apps.
no service fee for basic live viewing
and the addition of Bluetooth makes setup even easier and will allow you to connect optional home-monitoring accessories in the future
cons: You may experience some lag with the video and audio, depending on the speed of your Internet service
PC-free setup isn't available for Android devices at launch
Camera isn't weather-proof and can't be placed outside

customer_reviews.title: you could not have asked for a better product or customer service
customer_reviews.text: Dropcam was *amazing* when they started; you could not have asked for a better product or customer service. BUT, since the switched to NEST they have gone rapidly downhill. Camera downtime occurs 2 to 3 times a month (it's been down almost 4 hours so far this morning). Customer service is almost non-existent - hold time varies from 40 minutes to over 2 hours. Hundreds of unsatisfied customers can be found on their Facebook page. I'm looking for an alternative now. What sucks is that I bought 6 cameras and am paying for cloud service and I'm not sure if they will refund any of that. Bottom line, purchase at your own risk.
customer_reviews.author: L. Kurtz

customer_reviews.title: Google came and mest up a good thing.
customer_reviews.text: In the past I can put my camera behind a window and leave the night vision off. Nest gave you the option to turn the camera recording light off so I wouldn't get a reflection at night. Google came and acts like they care about privacy and removes this feature. Come on Google! It's not a webcam it's a security cam. Turn off the damn light! Camera is now useless in this location. Been paying for Nest since 2014, I will not be renewing.
customer_reviews.author: ERoach

customer_reviews.title: The 1080p Is A Lie
customer_reviews.text: Advertised on the box as 1080p. They lied. It's 720p. It's identical hardware to the Nest version. But they never released 1080p for the Pro and then only turned it on to sell more of their rebranded effort. So, while the hardware is identical to a Nest, Google, ignoring their Don't Be Evil mission statement, are evilly refusing to honor delivering it. Before you go buy the Nest to get what you paid for, ask yourself if you want to trust a department of Google that are clearly willing to ignore promised support and users who've already given them money so they can chase more money from new people.
customer_reviews.author: Nick D

customer_reviews.title: As a doggie cam?
customer_reviews.text: All I wanted this for was as my doggie cam. I wanted to be able to see him during the day while I'm at work. My experience? Watched a couple of YouTube videos explaining the simple setup. It works great on my iPhone app from work using LTE cell signal. I expected to have issues but, so far, this cam is great. But remember this: when you first place the camera....or when you move the camera....it takes about 10 minutes to settle down and provide a nice quality uninterrupted video signal along with audio. If my experience should change, I'll edit this review. Oh, I'm not using the CVR service and all works great!
customer_reviews.author: SkallyWag

customer_reviews.title: Good Camera, Expensive recording options
customer_reviews.text: I have had this plugged in for a year and half straight and it still works great. I do enjoy the camera. I enjoy the ipad feature where I can access it no matter where in the world I am, and that I can zoom in to a particular view point. It even works good a night if you have lights shining in your yard (I use this to watch my backyard) because the night time feature does not work through windows. I am however disappointed that it is so expensive to have the recording feature active and that they have not offered a lower price point with fewer days of recording or some sort of local recording means.
customer_reviews.author: Ds

customer_reviews.title: Security flaw allows cam to be taken over remotely
customer_reviews.text: look up nest cam hack bug on you ie. you'll find a description of a bug in dropcam, drpocam pro & some other models which allows hackers to knock your cams feed remotely. later articles said a software upgrade has been created. i contacted Nest to find out if i had the upgrade. i was told (a) that they're not aware of any security flaws and (b) the software is not upgradable. This makes no sense to me. If the cameras can be taken over and the method to do that was published on the web, then the company should acknowledge the issue and resolve it.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Still a great camera
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a few DropCams including a DropCam Pro. I needed to add another camera for security. I compared the latest Nest Cams and honestly, can't justify spending so much for one, when you have to pay for a monthly subscription on top of it. I ended up picking up a refurbished DropCam Pro for under $100 and at that price, I am very happy with it. The image quality is noticably better than the regular DropCam, the audio is much better, the wider angle view is noticeable and the night vision is much sharper.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Lafond

customer_reviews.title: Lack of offline support is disappointing
customer_reviews.text: You _must_ have Internet access for this to work. Offline mode is their most requested feature for the last several years, but I guess they don't care. I returned it. I've always wanted to get one, and being able to use it as as baby monitor was my way in. I was going to use it for the baby, and then when he got older I'd have a new awesome toy that we otherwise couldn't afford. Unfortunately, Internet outages do occur, and having to rely on Comcast in order to keep a safe eye on my son was just not an option. We returned it, and got some generic piece of crap video baby monitor instead.
customer_reviews.author: Hodor

customer_reviews.title: Would you like to continue
customer_reviews.text: Motion detection does not work very well. No sensitivity adjustment at all. Also once you subscribe, you have two options, "upgrade" or "Unsubscribe from CVR". If you try to unsubscribe, you will see this message. "Important: If you cancel your CVR plan, you will lose all of your stored videos, including any clips saved to your account. You will not receive a refund for the remainder of your annual plan. Would you like to continue?" So you have to unsubscribe just before renewal. If you miss the timing, you have to pay. I will never buy anything from NEST.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, bad service: can't watch recorded video that I'm paying for.
customer_reviews.text: 1) you have to purchase video recording service (and pay monthly) to really use it 2) camera does video recognition (to produce activity alerts) on server - so it records everything and eats traffic. But! 1) and 2) really not a problem for me. After DropCam was purchased by Nest - I CANNOT VIEW recorded video that I pay for!!! Only 1 frame at the time and it takes forever just to load 1 frame! Looks like they don't have enough servers to handle the load. The camera itself is pretty good: great picture day and night. But web cameras are cheap, and I was paying for the whole package. So 1 star unusable service.
customer_reviews.author: Naugrim

customer_reviews.title: This company and Nest is a shear disaster-avoid
customer_reviews.text: Bottomline- no matter how good the actual camera is, when you can't set up cloud recording aka Nest Aware, its useless. Its even worse when every time you try to call the company they give you a different answer, all being wrong. The problem apparently lies in the merger with Nest, Dropcam speaks one language and Nest speaks another and they haven't hired a translator yet. Let me be clear, the camera works, installs easily and has good quality and resolution and sound. If you never want to record anything go for it, but you can probably find something a lot cheaper than the DropCam or NestCam to do that. Shame on this company.
customer_reviews.author: A. Stahly

customer_reviews.title: DropCam I love you!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the DropCam Pro, it took me sixty seconds to set up, I plugged it in and there they were my two Chihuahua's! I love that I can talk to them and see what's going on from anywhere, my office, my Iphone and Ipad. This DropCam is amazing! If you forget to turn a light on in the room, no problem the night vision kicks in and you see everything so clear! I have an open floor plan in my home and I'm ordering another ProCam for that room so I can see what's going on. If your thinking about a camera, the Procam is awesome and worth every penny! Love it! Thanks for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Nail Diva

customer_reviews.title: great for monitoring pets
customer_reviews.text: This was an incredible purchase and I can't believe I waited so long to make it. It was incredibly easy to set up. Under 5 minutes until it was up and running. We are able to monitor our whole living room and half of our kitchen with just one camera. We can also hear any noises in the room and also speak through the camera to get our dogs attention should we need to. Purchased the cheapest plan, but it seems to be working fine. Haven't needed to save any clips yet but seems to be an easy process. Also, the night vision works very well and automatically turns on when it becomes dark.
customer_reviews.author: GA Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Dropcam, I love you.
customer_reviews.text: I'm totally, shamelessly addicted to Dropcam. I travel a fair amount for work and with a new 8-month-old (our first) at home I really feel every minute I'm away. With a few of these around the house it doesn't feel quite so disconnected when I wake up in a hotel room. I can still follow along with the morning routine and have a full conversation with the wife from around the world. The 7 day DVR function is great for checking in on how things went when I'm in a different timezone. It's even replaced our baby-cam when I am at home since the range, image quality and sound is better than the expensive dedicated baby camera.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Bolick

customer_reviews.title: Works great when it works
customer_reviews.text: Works great when it works. The first one I received was DOA. I should have just returned it to Amazon, but I decided to contact customer support at dropcam. They said it was pretty much dead and they would send me a replacement. They sent me a refurbished unit. Not a new one. So I paid full price for a refurbished unit. This unit when it works, works well. Low light looks good. Nice wide viewing angle. But it constantly loses connection. At least once per hour. It's very frustrating. It's prevented me from buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: Flyinghawaiian

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE!!!  Does not perform real-time monitoring!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera but do not rely on this for real-time monitoring. The camera is supposed to notify you when activity is detected. Unfortunately, the notification is typically delayed by an hour. The folks at Dropcam are aware of this and admit there is no work-around. What good is a security cam if you are notified an hour after the incident has occurred??
customer_reviews.author: Bruunzweki

customer_reviews.title: Dropcam Pro as a Baby Monitor
customer_reviews.text: We are using the Dropcam Pr as a baby monitor. The setup on Mac OS X was a breeze. The developers nailed that one. The image quality, day and night is excellent. They nailed that one too. So what do I miss with the dropcam pro product? - A temperature sensor that allows to show room temperature in the stream window. - An app for the ROKU or Apple TV so we have an option to use it more effective as baby monitor. - An option to store/save video without the monthly fees. But if you do your research, you'll notice that the competition is not there yet. And without competition, the improvements will probably take some time...
customer_reviews.author: Peter H. Togel

customer_reviews.title: The crispness of the video is not what I would like. The online viewing of the timeline is a ...
customer_reviews.text: Had a stint where it was really buggy but it could have been my internet. The crispness of the video is not what I would like. The online viewing of the timeline is a pain in the rear. But it does work and its nice to control from a cell phone. ***NOTE THAT NEST took over dropcam and the new app is not as good as the last and after owning this for about 3 years its starting to go a little haywire. Its telling me the camera is off about 15 times a day and when I look at the video history it does not record all the time which I am paying for.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Use for baby monitor / nanny cam
customer_reviews.text: After trying a more expensive top-notch baby monitor that did not give good signal throughout the house, tried this and we can see so much more of the room and can zoom in and focus so much easier. The app is simple and multiple people can use it at the same time if you share your log in info. This would be perfect if the ability to speak through the app was instantaneous. To speak through the app, you have to record what you're going to say and then send it through. There is about a 2 or 3 second delay on video and audio.
customer_reviews.author: Jenni

customer_reviews.title: You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! We use it in our baby's room as a nanny cam and can check on him whenever we like. It gives this first time mom peace of mind. My husband logs in at work and reads a book to our son through the microphone. Pros: Color camera, night vision, great zoom, very clear picture, microphone for communication, iCloud recording, EASY SET UP, iPhone app, notifications for noise and movement (if you want). Cons: sometimes the app doesn't connect to the camera but it doesn't happen often and not enough to even knock a star off my review.
customer_reviews.author: Eve

customer_reviews.title: AWFUL Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: While generally I have had no issues with DropCam, today this camera had an outage today for about 6 hours so I wasn't able to see my CHILD for that long. Their customer service didn't respond to my email or to my social media. When I called I was on hold for an HOUR and then they told me that they didn't even KNOW what the issue was. People are using this to monitor their home, pets, children, etc. It is not ok to have an outage for that long no matter WHAT the excuse. This is enough to lose my business. Will be returning this and looking into SimpliCam! Oh also the microphone feature doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Sapna

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these. They work great except that they constantly alert me to the wind blowing the fans in my palmetto palm trees. The infrared mode does not work well peering through a window to see outside. I think this must be because the window temperature makes the camera 'see' the window more than outside scene. It's good peace of mind. I can look and see what's happening from my iPhone at anytime. It has a decent app interface with lots of options and adjustments. It's inconspicuous; see the picture to see if u can pick it out of the normal level of domestic clutter I recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: OrlandoShopper

customer_reviews.title: The product is nicely designed and very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: The product is nicely designed and very easy to set up. However, the deal breaker for me is that I did not want to pay a monthly or yearly fee to see the recording. In my opinion the system looses most of its usefulness without the recording. The pictures in the email alerts are not clear enough to be useful. I would consider buying it if they offer device recording capabilities like the other leading cameras. I would also prefer a white camera with a white cord. Thought it was strange to have a black camera with a white chord. It looks really bad handing on a wall with those two colors.
customer_reviews.author: Obithedog

customer_reviews.title: Product registered to someone else, and Nest wants me to jump thru hoops
customer_reviews.text: Tried to setup a refurbished dropcam pro thru Amazon Refurb department. After a couple of failed attempts to activate wirelessly, we tried connecting via computer. Once signed in to our account, we were told that the camera was "already associated with another account". Called Nest CS to have them fix it ... and were told that in order to have it done, we had to send them photos of the back of the camera, a copy of our purchase receipt, and it could take up to a week to hear back. Useless waste of time and I'll be returning immediately. How does Amazon approve the shipment of a product that is registered to someone else's name?!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Gresham

customer_reviews.title: No way to view video locally. Must always stream.
customer_reviews.text: The Good: The picture quality is lovely. The Bad: The camera cannot be accessed using a local IP for monitoring purposes. It must stream continuously to the nest servers which determine the alerts and send the emails. That's alot of bandwidth. The other - and more annoying - problem is that even though I mark a small area for alert purposes, I still get alerts for the unselected area - even though I have unchecked that outside area for alert purposes. There seems to be a way to turn the camera on and off via a schedule in order to save bandwidth - but that leaves the desired area unmonitored for periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: K. Horton

customer_reviews.title: limited wi-fi range and unable to record
customer_reviews.text: The wi-fi range is very limited, maybe because of its small size and lack of antenna. This is in comparison to several other (cheaper) models I have tried. In addition, after trying several IP cam software, I finally figured out that you cannot make a recording unless you pay the manufacturer a hefty monthly fee. Therefore, I returned this one, and bought a Samsung Smartcam Pro, which has better range, similar picture quality and wide-angle, and recordable on a number of ip cam software programs. UPS shipping is expensive, but for $200, this one is worth returning, and so it went back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Robert X.

customer_reviews.title: Twice the price of Dropcam, but not twice as good.!
customer_reviews.text: I've had the original Dropcam for a couple of years, it works and is quick to setup. I needed a second one, and the only option is now the Pro version. The Pro version cost $200 compared to the original that cost $100. But I don't really see $100, or even $50 improvement. Also, the pro camera body is all black, but the Cord is the same white cord, which really makes it stand out. Again, they both work and are easy to set up, but I prefer the original version at $100. I would like to add two more, but at $200 each, probably will look for an alternative camera.
customer_reviews.author: Massoud Vaziri

customer_reviews.title: Astonishingly simple to set up and run
customer_reviews.text: Monthly charges? Who wants to pay monthly charges? Not me. But figure this. Cameras like these can take hours and sometimes days to configure. The Dropcam takes about two minutes. The visual quality is excellent. As others have stated, the false positives are a weak point. I had to disable the alarm. If you can live without the alarm feature and you don't mind paying $10/month, this camera might be for you. There is a Foscam camera that is cheaper and that doesn't have monthly charges, but it's a challenge to set up and a challenge to maintain. The Dropcam is as simple to use as a toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Patience Carter

customer_reviews.title: Seriously flawed Alert System
customer_reviews.text: I just installed one of these as a 'security' system, after assuming that the device would be able to alert me to movement in the house. It can. Sort of. What isn't made clear until you dive deep into the forums, is that the device has a 30 minute 'reset' window. Meaning, if you leave the house, it will take the device 30 minutes to 'arm' to where you will get any alerts. In that time, someone could empty the entire house! They need to implement an 'arming' system on their iPhone app, which sets the alert time to instantaneous until you 'un-arm' it. Until they do that, worthless to me.
customer_reviews.author: T. Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic tool for pet owners!
customer_reviews.text: We've been using our Dropcam for about a year now to keep tabs on our dog. The videos are very clear, the alerting technology is great and the cloud storage is awesome. We have been able to crop portions of the recordings down and share with our dog trainer to determine specific training for his behaviors. This is a great camera and I highly highly recommend it. Also - their customer service is fantastic! When we moved recently we lost the wall mount portion. After a quick call to Nest customer support - they are FedEx'd us a new one for no charge.
customer_reviews.author: ~rjm

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable app = useless camera
customer_reviews.text: Unreliable app makes the camera itself useless. A significant percentage of the time you cannot view live activity through the app or review daily activity without the app crashing. On several occasions we have needed to go back and review activity in the baby's room during the day and find that we are unable to access that footage because the app continues to crash and/or improperly record and store the video. I do not feel the camera is providing the safety or reliability that should be expected at this price point and would advise anyone using this as a tool to monitor their children to look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera!
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this camera for several months and could not be more pleased. We were able to view the bird feeders while on vacation to make sure they were still full and didn't require filling from the house sitter. The camera is placed inside the living room window and keeps an eye on the front yard for us. I love that I get text alerts whenever there is activity outside or sounds inside/outside. We have also used it for viewing the dogs and cat inside the house while we are away a short time. We did sign up for the subscription and find it worth the money for us. The picture quality is excellent. Great product!I
customer_reviews.author: Retrievin'Gold

customer_reviews.title: Used to be great. Now very buggy, features no longer working...
customer_reviews.text: Used to work great. No longer reliable with iOS, and location-based on/off & recording now no longer works. This means that it's recording you AND using your network bandwidth WHILE you're at home, and it no longer reliably turns on when you leave. DO NOT BUY. Wait until they fix the problems that have popped up during the past few months. I have more than 4 DropCams, and I used to love them, but recently they are completely unreliable, and I DON'T like being recorded when I'm at home. I'm also signed up for the Cloud Video Recording for all of my DropCams, and that's my biggest issue... it no longer works reliably.
customer_reviews.author: Maverick Johns

customer_reviews.title: nanny/baby monitor
customer_reviews.text: great for nanny camera. we got this for our house to monitor nanny with our newborn baby. resolution is good, but not when you try to zoom in (to see our baby's face) which is okay. its great that it also has the mic feature ( so we don't have to call our nanny, we can actually use our phone app to communicate with her (only if we need to). I have no problem paying 150 for 2 camera/ year, but hope they can lower the camera price a bit, just because I only install 2 (kid and living room) and i would love to install more (dinning room, and family room).
customer_reviews.author: R.C.

customer_reviews.title: Best Home Surveillance I've ever seen or used
customer_reviews.text: Best Home Surveillance I've ever seen or used. I had one of the expensive ones professionally installed a few years ago, and it doesn't even come close to the quality and features of this unit. Yes, it has a monthly subscription charge to utilize the full features, but its well worth it. The zone detection and location notifications are excellent. As soon as i pull into my driveway, it turns off all my notifications so i don't get warned when i'm walking around the house. As soon as I leave, it automatically turns them back on. Picture quality is amazing. You cant go wrong with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonNut

customer_reviews.title: Nice security camera but....
customer_reviews.text: I can only give this 4 stars because of the app. The camera is great and everything you could want out of a security camera. However the app is awful. When this was Dropcam it was awsome, no lags no glitches nothing. Then came NEST. I get black out times consistently, not connected to my wifi, when I clearly have wifi, just hassles. It has gotten better over the last couple of months, still would reccomend, just know you can have these issues as well.
customer_reviews.author: Big Hamm Inc.

customer_reviews.title: First one burned out, but Nest customer service is tops
customer_reviews.text: It worked really well for about six months. Then one day the image turned to different versions of rainbow plaid static. It was strange because the camera had just been on a shelf and wasn't moved, disconnected, or anything. We also use our mobile devices to turn it off when not in use, so it seemed strange that the picture would go out like that. The reason I give four stars is because customer service, now Nest, was fantastic and promptly replaced it when I contacted them. So far the new camera is holding up well, so I'm hoping we just got a lemon the first time.
customer_reviews.author: lecarvan

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing image quality
customer_reviews.text: I've had a D-Link video monitoring cam for almost a year and wanted to upgrade to a camera with an increase field of view and two-way talk. Positives: Incredible packaging and sleek design, similar to all Apple products Super quick and easy to set-up Negatives: Field of view is wide but creates a weird fish-eye view Resolution blurs as soon as you pinch and expand the image Overall, I think the image quality is better on my $35 D-Link than the $199 Dropcam. As a result, I returned the product.
customer_reviews.author: Girl 415

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: We use this to obsessively monitor our baby. The video quality is fantastic, the lens is wide angle, and the night vision works great. The zoom is also great, and with their enhance feature after you zoom, the image quality is amazing. The app and online streamer is extremely useful. As is the feature that alerts you if there is movement or loud noises. Setup was easy as 1 2 3. And its easy enough to unplug ahd move elsewhere (we move it out of the baby's room to keep an eye on our cats when we're on vacation) We have not tried to mount it on a wall yet, but it comes with all the necessary hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Lu

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera even though it doesn't have z-wave
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera even though it doesn't have z-wave. The setup was fast and easy. The app is user friendly and simple to use. Take advantage of the 14 day free cloud service. While away from home, you can log into your timeline to see any past or current activity--live video not snapshots in color. Also, if you are concerned about security and don't want to worry about setting up IP addresses, configurations, and your camera being hacked, then the $99 for a year of cloud monitoring (7 days, then the recordings rollover) is well worth it and it gives you peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Pal

customer_reviews.title: Best Camera on the internet - hands down.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice product and service. VERY VERY easy to connect to the internet. You just only need your ID and Password for your network and it will automaticly connect to the wireless system in your house or business. The camera has a very good sharpe image and the interent service is quick and fast with NO lag. The pricing is value packed and very aggressive. You will not be disappointed in this purchase. GREAT service, GREAT product. What can I say? I have tried some of the others and each one had major problems or some drawback with the unit or service. I will soon be purchasing a second unit. I highly recommend this camera!
customer_reviews.author: D. Kent

customer_reviews.title: Clear picture & color. Good sound. Great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Clear picture and very fast and easy set up. I'm not tech savvy so I was concerned with set up being time consuming and difficult. I was pleasantly surprised that set up was fast and easy and instructions were very easy to follow. Took me about 10 minutes to set up (from time I opened box until I downloaded app on my smart phone and adjusted camera view). My 7 yo granddaughter could do it. I love that I can check on my family, dog and house when I'm away from home. I like that I can talk to my family and hear them through this small camera.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Skinner

customer_reviews.title: Technology is not there yet.
customer_reviews.text: Used it to monitor my baby. Returned it due to drops in connectivity. I know its not my internet as I steam a lot of other stuff without issues. Pros: Looks cool Easy setup Can use your phone to monitor anywhere Good quality video and mic Cons: The Dropcam sends data to its servers and then you download the data through your phone/computer. You cannot use your own hard drives to record. You must buy their service. Does not hold a steam, constantly drops and sometimes does not reconnect. Not reliable as a baby monitor.
customer_reviews.author: wes

customer_reviews.title: Great video quality
customer_reviews.text: Overall I'm really happy with this camera. The image quality is great, especially the night vision mode. The camera is super easy to set up and the web interface for viewing the video is easy to use. Cons: 1. Monthly fee is required to record historical video. 2. When switching to night vision mode the camera makes a noise that sounds like a lens or shutter opening/closing. This isn't a big issue except for times where the camera is struggling to figure out if night vision needs to be on or off. If you're looking for a turnkey solution and don't mind some fees buy this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased till you need to UPDATE Wifi!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is very easy to set up and very very convenient to check on pets or kids from the touch of my iPhone. Can see, hear and communicate thru it. Would highly recommend it!!! UPDATE: This was a wonderful security camera till we switched wifi password. We followed instructions on how to update Wifi password and it wouldn't connect!!! This is Day 3 that we're trying to connect but the app would close the moment it starts to Search for a camera. It shouldn't take a rocket scientist to update the password but apparently... I'm better off just getting a new camera to save all the time and frustration 😠
customer_reviews.author: JTV

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product.
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this thing! It's no cool that it has night vision, and VERY crisp picture. My dogs don't seem to respond to the 2-way speaker though. But that's not what I got this for anyway. I love that it has an app I can monitor while I'm gone. I liked it so much that I bought one as a gift for a friend who is a victim of domestic abuse and she is on the run from her ex-husband. Now, she can check the app before going in so she is sure he isn't waiting there for her! She was so grateful for it. Wonderful product, wish I had the money for more of them around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Alisson

customer_reviews.title: it's awesome. It's supposed to turn on when I leave ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing couldn't be easier. Just plug it into the wall and download the app, done! Picture quality and sound are decent. I got it to watch my dog while I am at work. I keep the Dropcam website open on my desktop all day, it's awesome. It's supposed to turn on when I leave and turn off when I get home. I've had a few occasions where for some reason it has stayed on or off at the wrong times, but you can always get it back on track in the app when you notice it. The app and website are extremely simple and user friendly. Very happy with this purchase, wish I had done it earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Trinity Lewis

customer_reviews.title: What's happening at home?
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 of these cameras that we use to monitor our home 24/7. Great resolution, and you can set each camera up with different parameters - sound/no sound, movement within a certain area(s), etc. Lots of flexibility in setting up the camera - including the type of notifications you would like to receive. We are incredibly pleased with these cameras. Fabulous little camera, great price, and a much cheaper monitoring cost than local companies. You can see what's going on from your iPhone, iPad or any computer.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Arnett

customer_reviews.title: Peace of Mind , great Camera to buy
customer_reviews.text: In my Humble opinion this Dropcam is Number #1 the best security camera to have . Set up smooth easy, great quality picture , Live streaming of your home free of charge . Great when you are away from home , see your house interior from anywhere in the world If you get a report the alarm went off , in one minute you can see if alarm is false , also good to see if no water leaks , you can also set up a large thermometer in view of camera , you can see temperature of your house if heating system is OK Sharp , great zoom . will buy another one soon
customer_reviews.author: S.B.G.

customer_reviews.title: Great baby monitor that can be used for many years to come.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful baby monitor with night vision. Works best in a big room setting, but 6 feet looking down on the cribs works good. Grandparents get to watch the kids sleep and play in their room too! We do not use the recording feature, but someday we might. Some complained about a delay in the video and sound which is only about 1 sec with our setup and the sound out of an iPhone 4 and 5 is loud enough. Only complaint was the wireless required excellent signal strength to work reliably, so I had to create a wireless repeater bridge and add a 2nd AP in the 2nd floor.
customer_reviews.author: WDD

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind, great technology at a great price. Get it now!
customer_reviews.text: The Dropcam is extremely easy to set up and has a great view range. Purchased on a cabinet in our kitchen, we're able to see all of my kitchen, living room, and front door. During your demo period, use the web app to set up monitoring zones in your house. When a sudden change in light or movement is seen in the zone, you can get a notification via the app or via your e-mail. It's a great feature when you're away from home, because the latency is low and you can get a bird's eye view into your house. We'll be purchasing more to cover additional entrances and our nursery after our child is born.
customer_reviews.author: KMG

customer_reviews.title: Camera faulty, but great customer service from Dropcam!
customer_reviews.text: okay I am going to try to be fair here... I purchased two of these cameras and this one is having connection problems it appears that the connection is bad where is the wire plugs into the camera. Dropcam is sending me a replacement camera and is paying for the return shipping and giving me 30 days to return the faulty product to them, I hate to give such a low rating but this camera did let me down in less than 60 days. Dropcam however seems to stand behind their product and for that reason I would recommend someone to purchase this. We have had no issues with our other camera.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Herron

customer_reviews.title: now nest cam and i love love love these
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say enough about these cameras. I have been suing these since they were drop-cam, now nest cam and i love love love these. the app is excellent, i love it better then the newer app. the connectivity is great. disconnect one? then connect it 3 months later? no worries.. still remembers all the settings. the price for recording is good, but even without the cloud plan you get notifications consistently and good video and sound. also you can use chat. THESE are to me the best wifi connected cameras period.
customer_reviews.author: Norford

customer_reviews.title: Still working on integrating dropcam to my smartthings network. ...
customer_reviews.text: Still working on integrating dropcam to my smartthings network. So far, I'm impressed by dropcam build, and website. I think only significant downside is cost of cloud storage, cost of camera compared to lesser known competitors and dropcam 's proprietary nature. I don't need cloud storage right now. What I plan to use is to use dropcam as a security camera. Smartthings has a photo burst mode to capture photos when motion is detected. Does need plug which could limit its location in the house. Also not weatherproof although I see 3rd party casing options.
customer_reviews.author: eid8801

customer_reviews.title: I'm in love...better than hard wired security system.
customer_reviews.text: Ill join the millions of other people who absolutely love the drop cam. I had a much more expensive Lorex wireless security system. Despite my efforts, we could never get it to consistently work. A friend recommended Drop Cam so I gave it a try. Setup is brutally simple - even my aging parents could install this without help. I highly recommend adding a week if cloud backup. While it's great to see what might be happening real time, being able to jump back is a nice feature. Works great on iPad, android, and iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: Peter A. Leman

customer_reviews.title: Extremely high quality and you can hear and talk into it.
customer_reviews.text: Dropcam is so EZ to setup! This security camera is sick! I really like it. I just HATE that they dont give you enough rewind on the previous hours or days. Just the moment when you need to see. ZERO recording. They need more competition! Hopefully someone will copy them and make the cloud recording more free then it is! The dropcam I would say is banking millions easily! More people should get into this business!..HAha oO yeah 30 days free on cloud recording then you pay a arm and a leg for cloud recordings! But it does give you moment notice when camera picks up noise or motion to your mobile.
customer_reviews.author: sTaLwArT 420

customer_reviews.title: Peek a Look from anywhere!
customer_reviews.text: Easiest camera I have ever set up. Works great. You must have high speed upload connection to internet for it to function properly. but does work on slower DSL if you just want to take quick looks. For longer viewing be sure your internet is fast. Uverse works but standard ATT DSL is very slow and camera lags and gives slow connection warnings. I use one at work to keep an eye on employees and one at home to check on pets. Does the job well! iPhone app is great, you can turn camera on/off remotely from app, and switch between cameras. Really cool. Better than our high end cctv system!
customer_reviews.author: Michael W.

customer_reviews.title: Works well for us!
customer_reviews.text: We built a small air conditioned area in our garage to keep our dogs in when we would crate them. We used this to be able to monitor them while we were out and it works wonderfully. We have since moved and now use it to monitor our apartment while we are gone and it works perfectly. We never have connection issues, the app on the iPhone shows a very clear image and you can zoom in and out and rotate your view.
customer_reviews.author: Linz Maurice

customer_reviews.title: Purchased Dropcam pro in march because of great reviews of many sources
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Dropcam pro in march because of great reviews of many sources.It has preformed well and has good quality video when connected to WI-fi verses 4g phone connection.The phone app has great easy to navigate video review function.The drop cam pro is 1080 video when Wi-fi connected.The new replacement camera "Nest" owned by Google is a lesser image quality and I believe they will be changing the functionality of the app. In my opinion it's the app that makes the camera great! If the phone app is degraded "Nest" will lose my yearly subscription to cloud storage and review. "Nest" needs to take note of the abundant negative reviews of their new "Nest" camera! "Humpty Dumpty"
customer_reviews.author: pigfly

customer_reviews.title: Good "starter" camera
customer_reviews.text: Hmm... Where do I begin? Let me start by saying I appreciate this technology. I enjoy having oversight of my home via my smartphone. However, there is a lot I dislike, such as: 1) the camera frequently goes "offline;" 2) it provides still images instead of continuous, streaming feed; 3) the motion sensor is at times too weak; and 4) there is a lot of power cord to camouflage. It is a good "starter" camera. It helped me figure out what I do/don't want in a home security camera. I plan to upgrade to something different soon.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Lilly

customer_reviews.title: This product is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing! I installed as a senior nanny cam to keep and eye on my invalid mother. The image is clear both day and night. The audio is terrific, I have been able to talk to her when I am at work using my smart phone, it's great peace of mind. The range of view is awesome, I can see the entire room and all entries. This product exceeded my expectations. It is reliable, easy to install and no monthly costs unless you purchase the very reasonable cloud storage. The price is extremely reasonable, this is top quality delivering all it advertises.
customer_reviews.author: Lori M.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Could not believe how easy the setup is. This really is user-friendly. Although the main goal for the cameras is security, the pets are curious and now star in an endless selection of clips, which have been sent to everyone we know. I was a bit hesitant to go for these, but they're worth every penny. Will be using their cloud storage as well when the free trial is up, as I think it's important to have good, clear prosecutable footage stored offsite just in case. We've had to rethink every aspect of our security due to conditions in our community, and we're glad to have this option.
customer_reviews.author: LoveThatRonWhite

customer_reviews.title: Image quality is good. Mounting bracket could maybe have a few more ...
customer_reviews.text: Well, it did take me three or four minutes to set up the first one, but now I've got six Dropcams and it really only takes about a minute to set up a new one. Tried a D-Link cam before these and never got it running in spite of stubbornly spending hours trying. The Dropcam was a real revelation on how simple a setup can be. Image quality is good. Mounting bracket could maybe have a few more options such as a magnetic base or some velcro, but you can do those things yourself and overall I'm very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Joe A.

customer_reviews.title: Nest Camera
customer_reviews.text: At the time this item was good for it’s money then was purchased by nest and now it’s Google and now the technology has advanced so if you want to purchase this item now don’t stay away
customer_reviews.author: Aurelio Ventrella Jr.

customer_reviews.title: defrauding customers!
customer_reviews.text: This sounds nuts but when I purchased this camera it was a 1080p camera, now it is a 720p camera... why? The only way to view the camera is through the software, now that Nest purchased DropCam, they lowered the max resolution on this camera to 720p!!! My box says 1080p, the software says max 720p and it wasn't always like this. It is a shame, I love the hardware but they really screwed up!
customer_reviews.author: J. Archer

customer_reviews.title: EZ Setup
customer_reviews.text: The easiest piece of tech I have ever installed. Very clear picture and sensitivemic. The field of view and enhanced views are super. Really a quality and inexpensive solution to home monitoring. Be sure your upload speed is .4Mbps or better. Mine wasn't and the video would come and go. Their superb support quickly ID'd the problem. It was a problem with my dsl router/modem and I was able to increased the upload speed to .5Mbps. now it runs flawlessly. To test your upload speed, run speedtest.net. It will show you your download and upload speeds. Waiting for them to add an outdoor camera!
customer_reviews.author: Big Pete

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Set this up very quickly with a planned vacation to keep an eye on my dogs and more specifically the pet sitter. What a great product. Video is very clear and two way audio is great. I control primarily from my iPhone which is very convenient. While I would prefer being able to store the video to a local memory card, I'm still very happy with my purchase. Even with the requirement of the annual cloud purchase, at least I know I won't run out of space. Also I can review my video at any point in time.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara L. Washington

customer_reviews.title: Great camera. Not great Wifi range.
customer_reviews.text: We have a Dropcam Pro and a Dropcam HD. The Pro has great video quality, noticeably better than the HD in both good and low light. As with the HD, the Pro has poor Wifi range. We had to add a Wifi range extender/repeater in the room in which both of the Dropcams live in order to get them to work reliably. Would I buy this product again? Yes, as evidenced by that we own two Dropcams bought at different times. It's not perfect, but it's a great tool for those with young children or pets.
customer_reviews.author: T. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the hype
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Install/setup is very easy App is easy to use Camera can be used anywhere.. as long as there is a plug nearby Cons: Cloud recording is expensive For the price of this camera, the picture quality is not great at all The zoom in quality is even worse.. you can't see small details at all The lag is pretty bad I wouldn't buy this camera again.. my brother-in-law bought a cheaper one and is way better. I only use mine in our nursery.
customer_reviews.author: Zeb

customer_reviews.title: Set up was a breeze
customer_reviews.text: We opted for this camera system after looking for alternatives to the traditional alarm system. Our experiences with a traditional alarm system were dismal between forgetting to turn it on or triggering false alarms. With this system we have a hands on approach to security that filters through whats happening with their great array of mobile apps and web application. After seeing what the "cloud" service afforded us we were immeadiatly swayed to pay for the service. Most convenient is the ability to begin the motion alert system once you leave the house with your iPhone, and turning off the alert system once the iPhone is detected back "home". We couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo Marenco

customer_reviews.title: Valuable Insurance Policy - Look no Further!
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the investment, and worth the 7 day DVR for my small business. Someone stole my wife's phone from under her nose while she was running the store, and this camera caught them. It's great for quick two way communication via the mobile app (I've used it on Android and iOS - with no problems and no major differences). I also like the feature of being able to record the video with virtual DVR and the email alerts when the camera loses video/internet. Great little insurance policy, that's what I call it!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Storme King

customer_reviews.title: Effective monitoring using cost efficient cameras
customer_reviews.text: I started by using one camera indoor to see the quality and reliability of this camera for three months. Quality was effective- clear picture quality, wide angle coverage, clear night vision, etc. etc. Whereas, the reliability is dependent on the bandwidth signal of Wi-Fi. Even though the camera might be working but if the Wi-Fi is slow the camera stops working. After using it for six months, I have now purchased two additional cameras for my house and two cameras for my parents house so that they can monitor their house as well. Overall, I recommend this product. I hope Dropcam is working on the outdoor camera as well!
customer_reviews.author: a NY-Staten Islander

customer_reviews.title: Recommended with reservations and no Home kit Support or Recording to iCloud?
customer_reviews.text: Not many updates, no home kit support yet for iOS however it is firmware upgrade-able. Runs hot when using night vision. If you want recording you must pay high monthly charges, no iCloud support for recordings. Minor grumblings aside this product works as expected and I do recommend however the iOS app needs refinement as it will drain your phone and it will make it run hot when other remote services and apps do not have the same effect. Plan ahead to have a charger nearby for extended or overnight use.
customer_reviews.author: Jason G

customer_reviews.title: Stay away fr this product
customer_reviews.text: Dont buy this product!! Absoultely unreliable service/connection. Keeps dropping signal though model and camera are less than 10 fr fr each other. And when you call support line, you need at least 10-15min before getting a live person to start helping you. I just got this product less than one week ago, had to call twice for support, and now will just return
customer_reviews.author: Jezabel

customer_reviews.title: Great for what I needed.  If you just want monitoring it's great.  If you want recording, it's expensive.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I raise Guide Dogs for the Blind puppies and wanted to monitor the puppy in the crate when I was not at home. We had had some barking issues. I like that it notifies you when there is noise and I like that you can speak through the speaker even when you are far from the camera. I just don't like the subscription recording. It seems you should be able to do some short recordings without the hefty fee.
customer_reviews.author: Swedish Mama

customer_reviews.title: It took LESS than 60 seconds to set-up...
customer_reviews.text: So many people are complaining in their reviews about the Geolocation "turn on/turn off" issue, but honestly... I want mine on all the time so it's not an issue at all. The Dropcam Pro installed effortlessly and the app works just as I would expect. I have no issue paying $99 a year to store a week's worth of video at a time on their Cloud DVR servers. Honestly, people are just whiners sometimes. This is a great purchase, highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: S. Bourne

customer_reviews.title: Great! But not for everyone
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect camera for monitoring your pets. The 130 degree angle i perfect for mounting on a corner and getting the entire room. Problem that many people complain about is the cloud service. If you don't want to pay then this camera isn't for you. I think $10 a month or $99 a year is a steal to watch your home and monitor your pets. However, some people may disagree. If you want a quality product that is easy to setup and has great picture quality then this product is for you! Just make sure you're ready to plop down $10 a month.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: I like this. Its so fun to see my daughter ...
customer_reviews.text: I like this. Its so fun to see my daughter in such a good picture, directly streaming to my phone. the sound is fantastic. but I don't like that the notifications are hit or miss. I use this to keep an eye on my daughter and if theres babysitters I want to nanny cam them. but I setup for it to notify my phone when theres movement in a certain area, and when it hasn't for a seemingly long time, I'll open the monitor and it will have randomly logged me out! frustrating. a little too finicky.
customer_reviews.author: Lakota S

customer_reviews.title: Love the Dropcam Pro
customer_reviews.text: Love the Dropcam Pro, it is the third Dropcam I have purchased. The Pro definitely has a better night vision capability to it. I pay for all three cameras to have the cloud recording storage, so even if someone was to break in and destroy the camera; I still have access to the footage. I also like the ability to remote view the camera as well as the two way microphone so you can have a conversation with the person at the end of the camera. Very easy to set up to your wireless network. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey B.

customer_reviews.title: Dependent on constant internet connection.
customer_reviews.text: First, the camera, online portal, and DVR features are AMAZING. This wonderful online presence comes with a rather serious shortcoming. When the internet is off, you will never have any idea what happened in the supervised area. If the unit could store an hour or two of video internally and attempt to upload it later when connectivity is restored, it would be an easy 5 star item. As shipped, it is at best some kind of extreme nanny-cam, totally unsuitable for anything even remotely resembling security camera duty.
customer_reviews.author: B. Swartz

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is very easy to set up. The picture quality is very good in daylight and fair at night. Does not work well through a window at night but fine in daylight. The on line recorder is great for $100 yr. the IPhone app works very well. Wish dropcam made an outdoor camera. I would recommend this to a friend that was looking for an indoor camera for close range (100' or less) that can give you a good pic that you could see who it is in your home. The zoom pic is nice but as you zoom the res falls off quickly.
customer_reviews.author: 60’scarlover

customer_reviews.title: DropCam Pro
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! I have the DropCam also and they are both terrific, but the Pro version has a much sharper picture and the wider view is worth it. I use the cameras to monitor my house inside and outside (the outside camera is monitoring outdoors from the inside, not being put outside. It would freeze in the winter). I have used several internet cameras and I have found these DropCam's to be the best. And they are very reasonably priced. Setup is literally minutes - so easy and reliable. I view my cameras on my iphone5 and ipad - flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Scuba Paws

customer_reviews.title: Not for vacation homes!
customer_reviews.text: NOT for vacation homes! Very disappointed to find that if your router stops for any extended time then restarts your camera will not reconnect to your network. If you are not available to reconnect the cameras you are out of luck until you return to the home you are monitoring - sort of defects the purpose of a $200 camera. Hope they have a solution since a lot of buyers like myself are using this to monitor a home during their time away. Wish I knew this before the investment into two cameras!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel E. Eyer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera --great company--extremely easy to set up. This company will only get better as these cameras become more popular. There has been a lot of requests for Dropcam to make an outside unit. The camera is attractive and does a decent job both day and night. It is very easy to log into when you're away from home. The monthly fee is reasonable and there is a choice of subscriptions, although you do not a subscription in order to use the camera and view from anywhere in the world.Very smart idea and design.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce D. Verfaillie

customer_reviews.title: Best camera
customer_reviews.text: I have been a drop cam user for last 4 years. Finally have bought Dropcam Pro now and been using it for last 3 months. While I would give 5 stars even to drop-cam, drop cam pro stands out with a 5.1/5 stars (if there is any such rating). The picture quality of Pro is far superior with a HD quality view. Also the angle of coverage is much better with covering 90% of a room when kept in the middle and center wall. The best of all elements is ability to zoom in at any point with pretty good picture quality. Ability to talk on microphone is a huge plus and me and my family loves it.
customer_reviews.author: A-Z ON

customer_reviews.title: PRO, wireless and wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Wow a product that gets delivered as fast as they said, sets up in less than five minutes, delivers all they advertised and didn't require an engineering degree and then operates as advertised! In fact it performed so well I scratched my original plan and bought a second Pro model instead of the standard model. Great way to keep of "midnight creepers" Nd other goings on after lights out. Especially like.the ability to.turn.off the status light so kids have no idea if I'm monitoring or not and the ability to listen also.....priceless.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: A Fault in their Logic
customer_reviews.text: The Dropcam Pro hardware is great. The night vision, movement detection, etc are very good quality. But the fatal flaw has always been its reliance upon an internet connection to function. There is no "local network only" option -- if your connection goes down, your Dropcam goes down. The past few weeks we've seen another flaw -- when the Dropcam/Nest servers go down, so does your camera. So if you rely to watch your baby (or any other critical task), I'd be hard pressed to recommend you buy this camera.
customer_reviews.author: b

customer_reviews.title: Yes! 2 minute set-up!
customer_reviews.text: After weeks of researching and weighing the cost of surveillance versus how much we really wanted to protect our "stuff"; we decided to try an indoor camera first. Absolutely, the easiest set-up of all the network additions I've added over the last years. 2 minutes from start to finish....I timed myself! We can view our animals, our stuff, and hear what's going on. Great pictures for our needs, great nightime view, nothing more fun than timelapsing the glowing eyes of 6 cats running around all night! WHEN, they put out their outdoor camera, we'll be first in line. I'm not even withholding a star until they come out with their outdoor version, because this camera deserves 5 stars right now.
customer_reviews.author: Elena

customer_reviews.title: not easy to take screenshots when the baby does something cute ...
customer_reviews.text: Previously I would have given this 4.5-5 stars, now I give it 3-3.5 stars. Recently they changed software from their Dropcam to Nest. Less convenient, had to sign up for something new to use it, but most importantly, video quality is much lower using the same hardware. Less important but inconvenient: not easy to take screenshots when the baby does something cute and if you want to record anything you have to sign up for the cloud recording service (why can't I record them to a local storage?). Overall though it does work, gives alerts to your phone with an image of what first triggered it so you don't have to open the stream to see what's going on.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Feak

customer_reviews.title: this is the best of the two
customer_reviews.text: This is an HD style unit. Very easy to set up, just attache to a computer, put in the wifi password you want to use, unplug, plug into wall, it works (have to log into the web site, it's free). If you want to have it record and continually save the last two weeks you'll have to subscribe. I travel the world, I mean the world, and I can check into my how with three of these at any time. works in the dark, day, and keeps on recording. With the subscription you can also save clips if you need to. Clear and colorful in day mode.
customer_reviews.author: Cpt Roland Jarvis

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had thought of this sooner!! This is a great camera-- I got it for my cats - to watch them while I was away. I can watch on my iphone. The product said that it could only be viewed on an iPad 3rd generation or higher but I can watch just fine on my iPad 2. The audio works great. I was playing with it and talked to one of my cats while I was gone and she looked right at the camera. I had read all the reviews of several items and chose this one and am glad I did!!
customer_reviews.author: beckyncats

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Great video okay sounds and amazingly easy set up. My only issue with this product is the motion dections is not the greatest it keeps thinking it is seeing motion in my basement and nothing is there. I contacted customer support and they got back to me in less then 6 hours AMAZING!!! they gave me a free month of video recording to help label motion on the video so i dont get random alerts. If you are looking for a easy set up camera with amazing customer service and great video quality look no farther and just buy it
customer_reviews.author: David Ludwig

customer_reviews.title: Good product and super easy to set up and get running
customer_reviews.text: Great product for checking in on things when you are gone. You can set up alerts that come to your email if you have a smart phone. Mine came with a 2 week trial of the online recording which lets you go back and view something at a later time. You then have to purchase that if you want to keep that as an option. Otherwise it's just live camera viewing with no record option. This is so simple to set up and get running. Everything was up and running in about 5 to 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Bright_Idea

customer_reviews.title: Needs enhancement ASAP
customer_reviews.text: The Dropcam Pro generally works as advertised with one big exception, you can only register one cell phone to use location services to enable the camera when you leave and disable it when you come home. This means anyone else living in the home will be videoed unless you go through the hassle of turning off the camera or creating a complicated schedule of when the camera should be on/off. This is a huge draw back that hopefully Dropcam will rectify by supporting at least 2 phones using location services.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Baby Monitor and security camera
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised and then some. Has been very reliable, just make sure you have a reliable wifi network at your location. Has a very wide-angle lense so if you are using it for a baby monitor you may have to place it pretty close to the subject. Works great on IPAD and IPHONE. If you are using it via web browser you may get that spinning icon (as if it's trying to load the image) - however, I found out it was my firewall blocking certain ports. Opened up outbound tcp and spinning icon is now gone.
customer_reviews.author: amzUSR

customer_reviews.title: Flat out the Best Wifi Video Cameras Available.
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous home security/monitoring cameras. Excellent resolution, TRULY simple set up/installation and manipulation of the user interface (I'm a technical troglodyte) and very good value for money. The cloud recording service is reasonable (especially with the multiple camera discount) and very useful (and EASY to use) when you need to review historic footage. I'm super happy with the DropCams; I'm less happy with the customer service after acquisition by NEST...
customer_reviews.author: HOODsters

customer_reviews.title: Awesome - ordered another!  Cloud service is the best part!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup - works like a champ. Apps for Apple iPhone and android work great too. $100 bucks a year to store to cloud. Very happy that they did not waste resources saving to local memory card which I would never look at anyway. Awesome deal. Just ordered another one. Took literally two minutes to setup and now while away from home - can easily check on my cats. I can tell now that they miss me. Not.
customer_reviews.author: E. Reilly

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I researched monitors for my baby for hours and they all had mixed reviews. I wanted a baby monitor without the bulk. I bought this one due to being able to view live video through an app or through my computer which works great! I'm looking at my baby right now and the night vision is great. Sound is good. Dropcam is awesome! Set up is very easy. Will probably get another one if we have another baby. UPDATE: My son is 9 mo old and I still love this monitor. I watch my baby online or from my iphone. Best baby monitor without the remote!
customer_reviews.author: Macky

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to setup and use
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to setup and use. Video image is excellent and I like that I can listen only or listen and talk to anyone in the room. Turn off the motion sensor unless you need it as a security camera or it will keep sending you text messages that it sensed movement. Put the app on my cell phone and tablet. Easy to use. I really like that Nest bought the Dropcam company and Nest is owned by Goggle. I'm sure expanded uses an innovation won't be far behind.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbio

customer_reviews.title: Excellent baby monitor
customer_reviews.text: Hubby can check in on baby while he's at work and traveling. EXCELLENT NIGHT VISION Higher quality video than ave. monitor. Easy to transport from room to room. Option to record with paid service ($10/mo-which means capturing "firsts" -most monitors you can't record at all, even though it costs money we think it's worth the service) We use this with our IPad and phones. We love this camera and feel we made the right choice.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

product_meta.title: Dropcam Pro Wi-Fi Wireless Video Monitoring Security Camera
product_meta.description: Style:New| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingDropcam Pro Internet Wi-Fi Video Monitoring Cameras help you stay connected with what you love, no matter where you are. In less than a minute, you'll have it set up and securely streaming high-definition video to you over your home Wi-Fi. Use it to watch your home, your baby, the dog or your small business. Every camera comes with Night Vision, HD video, Two-Way Talk and Digital Zoom. Paired with secure online Cloud Video Recording (CVR), you can watch live and recorded video from anywhere on any device. Dropcam makes monitoring what you love and finding peace of mind easier than ever. Watch from any device such as your Apple Mac, Windows PC, iPhone, iPad, iPod touch or Android device. All you need is a Wi-Fi network paired with the free and easy-to-use Dropcam App. Watch what you love while away with Dropcam. Please note: If your camera is having trouble connecting to your Wi-Fi network you may have a weak connection between the camera and your router. To test the Wi-Fi signal that your camera is receiving, To test the Wi-Fi signal that your camera is receiving, move your camera closer to your router. There might be interference coming from other electronic devices near your camera. Try to reduce the number of connected devices near the camera. Cordless phones, baby monitors, microwave ovens, garage door openers and Wi-Fi speakers are just a few of many devices that are notorious for causing interference. If your camera is located close to electronic equipment with a large power source, such as a large screen television or home theater system, try moving the camera further away from these devices. Sometimes only a few feet will make a difference. You can turn HD video off to reduce the bandwidth the camera uses by half. This will help improve the camera's reliability, but it could result in lower video quality.
feature_bullets: Stunning Video Quality: New optics and updated image sensor provide 2x sharper video
60 Second Setup: Connect to Wi-Fi via computer or iOS mobile device via Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE), live stream from your Dropcam security camera in under a minute
Incredible Field of View: 130 degrees diagonal, plus Zoom and Night Vision, so you don't miss a thing
Stay Connected with Two-Way Talk, Intelligent Alerts, Scheduling and Mobile & Web apps

Cloud Video Recording (CVR): Review footage and make clips with optional secure offsite recording. Dropcam cloud recording securely records up to 30 days of footage for you to review after it's happened. Activity detected by your camera is highlighted on your cloud recording timeline for quick reference, and you can share and save clips of your recorded footage. Dropcam cloud recording is optional and you can subscribe and unsubscribe any time you like.
